item.title: Tokyo Electron Site Visit | Nov. 12
item.description: Join the CCPD and Tokyo Electron on Wednesday, November 12th for an on-site info session where you can network with Tokyo Electron (TEL) employees, gain insights into their company culture and cutting-edge technologies, and take a guided tour of their facility. Don’t miss this opportunity to explore career possibilities and ask questions in an informal setting. Lunch and transportation will be provided, but space is limited–register in Handshake!

item.description: Come learn about Abbott’s Clinical Associates program and discover a career in electrophysiology! Meet with a representative from Abbott on Tuesday, November 11th from 6-7pm–details and registration can be found in Handshake.

item.title: Webex Training Session with Jim Evans | Nov. 6
item.description: Join a remote training session on Thursday November 6th, 11am-noon, to explore the Webex application and its integration with Outlook and other productivity tools. You will learn key features, see how Webex enhances collaboration, and have your questions answered live. This session is open to all members of the Rensselaer community and will be conducted via Webex. Please register online: https://rensselaer.webex.com/weblink/register/r5f4f426986a28850bf23614d8ef1196a

item.title: Computer Science Colloquia - Chuchu Fan: Large Language Models Can Solve Real-World Planning Rigorously | Nov. 6
item.description: Date: Thursday, November 6, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Chuchu Fan is an Associate Professor (pre-tenure) in the Department of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AeroAstro) and Laboratory for Information and Decision Systems (LIDS) at MIT. Her research group, the Realm at MIT, works on developing computational tools that integrate rigorous mathematics into machine learning and AI for the design, analysis, and verification of safe, large-scale, and complex systems.
